Summary I'm currently a Senior Account Manager at Google in Ann Arbor, Michigan. My goal is to assist businesses of all industries and backgrounds with optimizations of their online advertising accounts through search and display strategies, social media, and multi-channel marketing initiatives.  
 
Prior to my employment with Google, I was responsible for online sales strategy at Unilever on the National Walmart Account for Frozen Indulgences - Ice Cream & Frozen Desserts. I assisted in the planning and forecasting of Unilever’s $300M Ice Cream Brand Plan Strategy and Multi-Million Dollar Trade Fund Budget, including: Breyers, Ben and Jerry’s, Popsicle, Klondike, Good Humor, and Starbucks Ice Cream. Within my initial months, I developed efficiencies for Breyers Packaged Holiday Demand Estimates. I was actively involved in special projects teams to better understand our customer and further ways to win in the marketplace.

Summary I am an online analyst with a passion for storytelling through data to help enable advertisers make the most of the web. 
 
I am currently working as an Industry Analyst in Google, delivering deep analytical insight to the worlds most sophisticated Travel advertisers. Daily experience involves working with ‘big data’ using SQL, Excel, R, developing narratives for advertisers, C levels and travel industry events. Other key tasks I perform frequently are internal revenue reporting, developing training programmes for Google’s account managers and working with a wide range of external resources to further provide exceptional market analysis. 
 
I have a background in Business and Politics with a particular passion for political persuasion online that I have completed a Masters in before joining Google in 2010. I have recently purchased a first home and now harbour a love hate relationship with IKEA furniture. Lynkarriere hos Google 
 
22-årige Martin Collignon har på rekordtid gjort karriere i Google. På første år af bacheloruddannelsen i International Business på CBS blev han tilknyttet søgegiganten som praktikant, og i 2013 blev han som den yngste nogensinde ansat på fuldtid i Googles nordiske afdeling. Nu er han så rykket til London, hvor han arbejder med en af verdens største annoncører. 
»Jeg er Insights Lead for amerikanske Procter & Gamble i Storbritannien og Norden. Jeg hjælper dem med at udnytte internettets potentiale og få dem på niveau med forbrugernes adfærd. Forbrugerne forventer, at brands giver dem relevante budskaber på rette tid og på tværs af medier og platforme, og det er min opgave at lære virksomhederne at tyde data og dermed forstå deres nuværende og potentielle kunder bedre,« forklarer han. 
Morten Petersen, der er industry leader hos Google, fortæller, at det ikke er tilfældigt, at Martin Collignon allerede har opnået så stor succes. 
»Han har et uudtømmeligt drive og et dybtfølt engagement for Google og sit arbejde. Det betyder, at han tager ansvar langt ud over sine ansvarsområder, og han viser gang på gang, at han sætter virksomhedens behov over sine egne. Han har en arbejdsmæssig modenhed, som er fuldstændig usædvanlig for en 22-årig.«

Summary I am passionate about brand building in the digital world. Constant connectivity through our ubiquitous mobile devices has exploded the number of moments in which brands can connect with people.  
 
Consumer behavior has thus changed forever. Today's battle for hearts, minds, and dollars is won (or lost) in micro-moments on the web. The key for brands is to have an aligned cross-device marketing strategy to be able to win in all the micro moments that matter on the web.  
 
Working in the forefront of digital marketing in Google for over 4 years have made me an expert in finding those important moments across the web and it has leveraged my deep analytical capabilities, online market knowledge and creative skills necessary to be a good digital advisor. I am uncomfortably excited about the future of digital and have huge passion in what I do. Summary I am passionate about brand building in the digital world. Summary Seasoned strategy & operations leader, with experience leading go-to-market strategies and operational improvement initiatives for large digital media sales teams.  
 
I have a keen ability to get to the heart of a problem, and balance the big picture view with an understanding of the tiny details critical to executing a strategy. I am known for my ability to build strong relationships across an organization, which helps me bring together teams to collaborate on large-scale, cross-functional projects.  
 
In my free time, I can usually be found feeding, bathing, or shuttling my two young sons to various activities. I love cooking and entertaining, trying new restaurants, and finding new projects to fix up my 100+ year home. When I have time to read, it's typically non-fiction, in a constant effort to understand what makes people tick ("Switch" by Chip & Dan Heath, "Outliers" by Malcolm Gladwell and "Freakonomics" are some favorites).
